of the current request. See <<documents/003_common_concepts/follow, here>> for details.

[source]

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]

[source]

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]

|<<types/boolean,Boolean>>

|===

[id="services/openstack_network_provider/methods/update"]
==== update [small]#PUT#

Updates the provider.

For example, to update `provider_name`, `requires_authentication`, `url`, `tenant_name` and `type` properties,
for the OpenStack network provider with identifier `1234`, send a request like this:

[source]

PUT /ovirt-engine/api/openstacknetworkproviders/1234

With a request body like this:

[source,xml]

<openstack_network_provider> <name>ovn-network-provider</name> <requires_authentication>false</requires_authentication> <url>http://some_server_url.domain.com:9696</url>; <tenant_name>oVirt</tenant_name> <type>external</type> </openstack_network_provider>

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`async`
|<<types/boolean,Boolean>>
|In
|Indicates if the update should be performed asynchronously.

|`provider`
|<<types/open_stack_network_provider,OpenStackNetworkProvider>>
|In/Out
|The provider to update.

|===

[id="services/openstack_network_providers"]
=== OpenstackNetworkProviders

This service manages OpenStack network providers.

.Methods summary
[cols="20,80"]
|===
|Name |Summary

|`add`
|The operation adds a new network provider to the system.

|`list`
|Returns the list of providers.

|===

[id="services/openstack_network_providers/methods/add"]
==== add [small]#POST#

The operation adds a new network provider to the system.
If the `type` property is not present, a default value of `NEUTRON` will be used.

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`provider`
|<<types/open_stack_network_provider,OpenStackNetworkProvider>>
|In/Out
|

|===

|<<types/open_stack_network_provider,OpenStackNetworkProvider[]>>

[id="services/openstack_volume_authentication_key"]
=== OpenstackVolumeAuthenticationKey

.Methods summary
[cols="20,80"]
|===
|Name |Summary

|`get`
|

|`remove`
|

|`update`
|Update the specified authentication key.

|===

[id="services/openstack_volume_authentication_key/methods/get"]
==== get [small]#GET#

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`follow`
|<<types/string,String>>
|In
|Indicates which inner links should be _followed_.

|`key`
|<<types/openstack_volume_authentication_key,OpenstackVolumeAuthenticationKey>>
|Out
|

|===

[id="services/openstack_volume_authentication_key/methods/get/parameters/follow"]
===== follow

Indicates which inner links should be _followed_. The objects referenced by these links will be fetched as part
of the current request. See <<documents/003_common_concepts/follow, here>> for details.

[id="services/openstack_volume_authentication_key/methods/remove"]
==== remove [small]#DELETE#

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`async`
|<<types/boolean,Boolean>>
|In
|Indicates if the remove should be performed asynchronously.

|===

[id="services/openstack_volume_authentication_key/methods/update"]
==== update [small]#PUT#

Update the specified authentication key.

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`key`
|<<types/openstack_volume_authentication_key,OpenstackVolumeAuthenticationKey>>
|In/Out
|

|===

[id="services/openstack_volume_authentication_keys"]
=== OpenstackVolumeAuthenticationKeys

.Methods summary
[cols="20,80"]
|===
|Name |Summary

|`add`
|Add a new authentication key to the OpenStack volume provider.

|`list`
|Returns the list of authentication keys.

|===

[id="services/openstack_volume_authentication_keys/methods/add"]
==== add [small]#POST#

Add a new authentication key to the OpenStack volume provider.

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`key`
|<<types/openstack_volume_authentication_key,OpenstackVolumeAuthenticationKey>>
|In/Out
|

|===

[id="services/openstack_volume_authentication_keys/methods/list"]
==== list [small]#GET#

Returns the list of authentication keys.

The order of the returned list of authentication keys isn't guaranteed.

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`follow`
|<<types/string,String>>
|In
|Indicates which inner links should be _followed_.

|`keys`
|<<types/openstack_volume_authentication_key,OpenstackVolumeAuthenticationKey[]>>
|Out
|

|`max`
|<<types/integer,Integer>>
|In
|Sets the maximum number of keys to return.

|===

[id="services/openstack_volume_authentication_keys/methods/list/parameters/follow"]
===== follow

Indicates which inner links should be _followed_. The objects referenced by these links will be fetched as part
of the current request. See <<documents/003_common_concepts/follow, here>> for details.

[id="services/openstack_volume_authentication_keys/methods/list/parameters/max"]
===== max

Sets the maximum number of keys to return. If not specified all the keys are returned.

[id="services/openstack_volume_provider"]
=== OpenstackVolumeProvider

.Methods summary
[cols="20,80"]
|===
|Name |Summary

|`get`
|

|`importcertificates`
|Import the SSL certificates of the external host provider.

|`remove`
|

|`testconnectivity`
|In order to test connectivity for external provider we need
to run following request where 123 is an id of a provider.

|`update`
|Update the specified OpenStack volume provider in the system.

|===

[id="services/openstack_volume_provider/methods/get"]
==== get [small]#GET#

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`follow`
|<<types/string,String>>
|In
|Indicates which inner links should be _followed_.

|`provider`
|<<types/open_stack_volume_provider,OpenStackVolumeProvider>>
|Out
|

|===

[id="services/openstack_volume_provider/methods/get/parameters/follow"]
===== follow

Indicates which inner links should be _followed_. The objects referenced by these links will be fetched as part
of the current request. See <<documents/003_common_concepts/follow, here>> for details.

[id="services/openstack_volume_provider/methods/import_certificates"]
==== importcertificates [small]#POST#

Import the SSL certificates of the external host provider.

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`certificates`
|<<types/certificate,Certificate[]>>
|In
|

|===

[id="services/openstack_volume_provider/methods/remove"]
==== remove [small]#DELETE#

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`async`
|<<types/boolean,Boolean>>
|In
|Indicates if the remove should be performed asynchronously.

|`force`
|<<types/boolean,Boolean>>
|In
|Indicates if the operation should succeed, and the provider removed from the database,
even if something fails during the operation.

|===

[id="services/openstack_volume_provider/methods/remove/parameters/force"]
===== force

Indicates if the operation should succeed, and the provider removed from the database,
even if something fails during the operation.

This parameter is optional, and the default value is `false`.

[id="services/openstack_volume_provider/methods/test_connectivity"]
==== testconnectivity [small]#POST#

In order to test connectivity for external provider we need
to run following request where 123 is an id of a provider.

[source]

POST /ovirt-engine/api/externalhostproviders/123/testconnectivity

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`async`
|<<types/boolean,Boolean>>
|In
|Indicates if the test should be performed asynchronously.

|===

[id="services/openstack_volume_provider/methods/update"]
==== update [small]#PUT#

Update the specified OpenStack volume provider in the system.

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`async`
|<<types/boolean,Boolean>>
|In
|Indicates if the update should be performed asynchronously.

|`provider`
|<<types/open_stack_volume_provider,OpenStackVolumeProvider>>
|In/Out
|

|===

[id="services/openstack_volume_providers"]
=== OpenstackVolumeProviders

.Methods summary
[cols="20,80"]
|===
|Name |Summary

|`add`
|Adds a new volume provider.

|`list`
|Retrieves the list of volume providers.

|===

[id="services/openstack_volume_providers/methods/add"]
==== add [small]#POST#

Adds a new volume provider.

For example:

[source]

POST /ovirt-engine/api/openstackvolumeproviders

With a request body like this:

[source,xml]

<openstack_volume_provider> <name>mycinder</name> <url>https://mycinder.example.com:8776</url>; <data_center> <name>mydc</name> </data_center> <requires_authentication>true</requires_authentication> <username>admin</username> <password>mypassword</password> <tenant_name>mytenant</tenant_name> </openstack_volume_provider>

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`provider`
|<<types/open_stack_volume_provider,OpenStackVolumeProvider>>
|In/Out
|

|===

[id="services/openstack_volume_providers/methods/list"]
==== list [small]#GET#

Retrieves the list of volume providers.

The order of the returned list of volume providers isn't guaranteed.

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`follow`
|<<types/string,String>>
|In
|Indicates which inner links should be _followed_.

|`max`
|<<types/integer,Integer>>
|In
|Sets the maximum number of providers to return.

|`providers`
|<<types/open_stack_volume_provider,OpenStackVolumeProvider[]>>
|Out
|

|`search`
|<<types/string,String>>
|In
|A query string used to restrict the returned volume providers.

|===

[id="services/openstack_volume_providers/methods/list/parameters/follow"]
===== follow

Indicates which inner links should be _followed_. The objects referenced by these links will be fetched as part
of the current request. See <<documents/003_common_concepts/follow, here>> for details.

[id="services/openstack_volume_providers/methods/list/parameters/max"]
===== max

Sets the maximum number of providers to return. If not specified all the providers are returned.

[id="services/permit"]
=== Permit

A service to manage a specific permit of the role.

.Methods summary
[cols="20,80"]
|===
|Name |Summary

|`get`
|Gets the information about the permit of the role.

|`remove`
|Removes the permit from the role.

|===

[id="services/permit/methods/get"]
==== get [small]#GET#

Gets the information about the permit of the role.

For example to retrieve the information about the permit with the id `456` of the role with the id `123`
send a request like this:

....
GET /ovirt-engine/api/roles/123/permits/456
....

[source,xml]

<permit href="/ovirt-engine/api/roles/123/permits/456" id="456"> <name>change_vm_cd</name> <administrative>false</administrative> <role href="/ovirt-engine/api/roles/123" id="123"/> </permit>

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`follow`
|<<types/string,String>>
|In
|Indicates which inner links should be _followed_.

|`permit`
|<<types/permit,Permit>>
|Out
|The permit of the role.

|===

[id="services/permit/methods/get/parameters/follow"]
===== follow

Indicates which inner links should be _followed_. The objects referenced by these links will be fetched as part
of the current request. See <<documents/003_common_concepts/follow, here>> for details.

[id="services/permit/methods/remove"]
==== remove [small]#DELETE#

Removes the permit from the role.

For example to remove the permit with id `456` from the role with id `123` send a request like this:

....
DELETE /ovirt-engine/api/roles/123/permits/456
....

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`async`
|<<types/boolean,Boolean>>
|In
|Indicates if the remove should be performed asynchronously.

|===

[id="services/permits"]
=== Permits

Represents a permits sub-collection of the specific role.

.Methods summary
[cols="20,80"]
|===
|Name |Summary

|`add`
|Adds a permit to the role.

|`list`
|List the permits of the role.

|===

[id="services/permits/methods/add"]
==== add [small]#POST#

Adds a permit to the role. The permit name can be retrieved from the <<services/cluster_levels>> service.

For example to assign a permit `create_vm` to the role with id `123` send a request like this:

....
POST /ovirt-engine/api/roles/123/permits
....

With a request body like this:

[source,xml]

<permit> <name>create_vm</name> </permit>

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`permit`
|<<types/permit,Permit>>
|In/Out
|The permit to add.

|===

[id="services/permits/methods/list"]
==== list [small]#GET#

List the permits of the role.

For example to list the permits of the role with the id `123` send a request like this:

....
GET /ovirt-engine/api/roles/123/permits
....

[source,xml]

<permits> <permit href="/ovirt-engine/api/roles/123/permits/5" id="5"> <name>change_vm_cd</name> <administrative>false</administrative> <role href="/ovirt-engine/api/roles/123" id="123"/> </permit> <permit href="/ovirt-engine/api/roles/123/permits/7" id="7"> <name>connect_to_vm</name> <administrative>false</administrative> <role href="/ovirt-engine/api/roles/123" id="123"/> </permit> </permits>

The order of the returned list of permits isn't guaranteed.

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`follow`
|<<types/string,String>>
|In
|Indicates which inner links should be _followed_.

|`max`
|<<types/integer,Integer>>
|In
|Sets the maximum number of permits to return.

|`permits`
|<<types/permit,Permit[]>>
|Out
|List of permits.

|===

[id="services/permits/methods/list/parameters/follow"]
===== follow

Indicates which inner links should be _followed_. The objects referenced by these links will be fetched as part
of the current request. See <<documents/003_common_concepts/follow, here>> for details.

[id="services/permits/methods/list/parameters/max"]
===== max

Sets the maximum number of permits to return. If not specified all the permits are returned.

[id="services/qos"]
=== Qos

.Methods summary
[cols="20,80"]
|===
|Name |Summary

|`get`
|Get specified QoS in the data center.

|`remove`
|Remove specified QoS from datacenter.

|`update`
|Update the specified QoS in the dataCenter.

|===

[id="services/qos/methods/get"]
==== get [small]#GET#

Get specified QoS in the data center.

[source]

GET /ovirt-engine/api/datacenters/123/qoss/123

You will get response like this one below:

[source,xml]

<qos href="/ovirt-engine/api/datacenters/123/qoss/123" id="123"> <name>123</name> <description>123</description> <max_iops>1</max_iops> <max_throughput>1</max_throughput> <type>storage</type> <data_center href="/ovirt-engine/api/datacenters/123" id="123"/> </qos>

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`follow`
|<<types/string,String>>
|In
|Indicates which inner links should be _followed_.

|`qos`
|<<types/qos,Qos>>
|Out
|Queried QoS object.

|===

[id="services/qos/methods/get/parameters/follow"]
===== follow

Indicates which inner links should be _followed_. The objects referenced by these links will be fetched as part
of the current request. See <<documents/003_common_concepts/follow, here>> for details.

[id="services/qos/methods/remove"]
==== remove [small]#DELETE#

Remove specified QoS from datacenter.

[source]

DELETE /ovirt-engine/api/datacenters/123/qoss/123

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`async`
|<<types/boolean,Boolean>>
|In
|Indicates if the remove should be performed asynchronously.

|===

[id="services/qos/methods/update"]
==== update [small]#PUT#

Update the specified QoS in the dataCenter.

[source]

PUT /ovirt-engine/api/datacenters/123/qoss/123

For example with curl:

[source]

curl -u admin@internal:123456 -X PUT -H "content-type: application/xml" -d \ "<qos><name>321</name><description>321</description><max_iops>10</max_iops></qos>" \ https://engine/ovirt-engine/api/datacenters/123/qoss/123

You will receive response like this:

[source,xml]

<qos href="/ovirt-engine/api/datacenters/123/qoss/123" id="123"> <name>321</name> <description>321</description> <max_iops>10</max_iops> <max_throughput>1</max_throughput> <type>storage</type> <data_center href="/ovirt-engine/api/datacenters/123" id="123"/> </qos>

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`async`
|<<types/boolean,Boolean>>
|In
|Indicates if the update should be performed asynchronously.

|`qos`
|<<types/qos,Qos>>
|In/Out
|Updated QoS object.

|===

[id="services/qoss"]
=== Qoss

Manages the set of _quality of service_ configurations available in a data center.

.Methods summary
[cols="20,80"]
|===
|Name |Summary

|`add`
|Add a new QoS to the dataCenter.

|`list`
|Returns the list of _quality of service_ configurations available in the data center.

|===

[id="services/qoss/methods/add"]
==== add [small]#POST#

Add a new QoS to the dataCenter.

[source]

POST /ovirt-engine/api/datacenters/123/qoss

The response will look as follows:

[source,xml]

<qos href="/ovirt-engine/api/datacenters/123/qoss/123" id="123"> <name>123</name> <description>123</description> <max_iops>10</max_iops> <type>storage</type> <data_center href="/ovirt-engine/api/datacenters/123" id="123"/> </qos>

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`qos`
|<<types/qos,Qos>>
|In/Out
|Added QoS object.

|===

[id="services/qoss/methods/list"]
==== list [small]#GET#

Returns the list of _quality of service_ configurations available in the data center.

[source]

GET /ovirt-engine/api/datacenter/123/qoss

You will get response which will look like this:

[source, xml]

<qoss> <qos href="/ovirt-engine/api/datacenters/123/qoss/1" id="1">…​</qos> <qos href="/ovirt-engine/api/datacenters/123/qoss/2" id="2">…​</qos> <qos href="/ovirt-engine/api/datacenters/123/qoss/3" id="3">…​</qos> </qoss>

The returned list of quality of service configurations isn't guaranteed.

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`follow`
|<<types/string,String>>
|In
|Indicates which inner links should be _followed_.

|`max`
|<<types/integer,Integer>>
|In
|Sets the maximum number of QoS descriptors to return.

|`qoss`
|<<types/qos,Qos[]>>
|Out
|List of queried QoS objects.

|===

[id="services/qoss/methods/list/parameters/follow"]
===== follow

Indicates which inner links should be _followed_. The objects referenced by these links will be fetched as part
of the current request. See <<documents/003_common_concepts/follow, here>> for details.

[id="services/qoss/methods/list/parameters/max"]
===== max

Sets the maximum number of QoS descriptors to return. If not specified all the descriptors are returned.

[id="services/quota"]
=== Quota

.Methods summary
[cols="20,80"]
|===
|Name |Summary

|`get`
|Retrieves a quota.

|`remove`
|Delete a quota.

|`update`
|Updates a quota.

|===

[id="services/quota/methods/get"]
==== get [small]#GET#

Retrieves a quota.

An example of retrieving a quota:

[source]

GET /ovirt-engine/api/datacenters/123/quotas/456

[source,xml]

<quota id="456"> <name>myquota</name> <description>My new quota for virtual machines</description> <cluster_hard_limit_pct>20</cluster_hard_limit_pct> <cluster_soft_limit_pct>80</cluster_soft_limit_pct> <storage_hard_limit_pct>20</storage_hard_limit_pct> <storage_soft_limit_pct>80</storage_soft_limit_pct> </quota>

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`follow`
|<<types/string,String>>
|In
|Indicates which inner links should be _followed_.

|`quota`
|<<types/quota,Quota>>
|Out
|

|===

[id="services/quota/methods/get/parameters/follow"]
===== follow

Indicates which inner links should be _followed_. The objects referenced by these links will be fetched as part
of the current request. See <<documents/003_common_concepts/follow, here>> for details.

[id="services/quota/methods/remove"]
==== remove [small]#DELETE#

Delete a quota.

An example of deleting a quota:

[source]

DELETE /ovirt-engine/api/datacenters/123-456/quotas/654-321 -0472718ab224 HTTP/1.1 Accept: application/xml Content-type: application/xml

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`async`
|<<types/boolean,Boolean>>
|In
|Indicates if the remove should be performed asynchronously.

|===

[id="services/quota/methods/update"]
==== update [small]#PUT#

Updates a quota.

An example of updating a quota:

[source]

PUT /ovirt-engine/api/datacenters/123/quotas/456

[source,xml]

<quota> <cluster_hard_limit_pct>30</cluster_hard_limit_pct> <cluster_soft_limit_pct>70</cluster_soft_limit_pct> <storage_hard_limit_pct>20</storage_hard_limit_pct> <storage_soft_limit_pct>80</storage_soft_limit_pct> </quota>

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`async`
|<<types/boolean,Boolean>>
|In
|Indicates if the update should be performed asynchronously.

|`quota`
|<<types/quota,Quota>>
|In/Out
|

|===

[id="services/quota_cluster_limits"]
=== QuotaClusterLimits

Manages the set of quota limits configured for a cluster.

.Methods summary
[cols="20,80"]
|===
|Name |Summary

|`add`
|Add a cluster limit to a specified Quota.

|`list`
|Returns the set of quota limits configured for the cluster.

|===

[id="services/quota_cluster_limits/methods/add"]

Add a cluster limit to a specified Quota.

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`limit`
|<<types/quota_cluster_limit,QuotaClusterLimit>>
|In/Out
|

|===

[id="services/quota_cluster_limits/methods/list"]
==== list [small]#GET#

Returns the set of quota limits configured for the cluster.

The returned list of quota limits isn't guaranteed.

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`follow`
|<<types/string,String>>
|In
|Indicates which inner links should be _followed_.

|`limits`
|<<types/quota_cluster_limit,QuotaClusterLimit[]>>
|Out
|

|`max`
|<<types/integer,Integer>>
|In
|Sets the maximum number of limits to return.

Indicates which inner links should be _followed_. The objects referenced by these links will be fetched as part
of the current request. See <<documents/003_common_concepts/follow, here>> for details.

[id="services/quota_cluster_limits/methods/list/parameters/max"]
===== max

Sets the maximum number of limits to return. If not specified all the limits are returned.

[id="services/quota_storage_limits"]
=== QuotaStorageLimits

Manages the set of storage limits configured for a quota.

.Methods summary
[cols="20,80"]
|===
|Name |Summary

|`add`
|Adds a storage limit to a specified quota.

|`list`
|Returns the list of storage limits configured for the quota.

|===

[id="services/quota_storage_limits/methods/add"]
==== add [small]#POST#

Adds a storage limit to a specified quota.

To create a 100GiB storage limit for all storage domains in a data center, send a request like this:

[source]

POST /ovirt-engine/api/datacenters/123/quotas/456/quotastoragelimits

With a request body like this:

[source,xml]

<quota_storage_limit> <limit>100</limit> </quota_storage_limit>

To create a 50GiB storage limit for a storage domain with the ID `000`, send a request like this:

[source]

POST /ovirt-engine/api/datacenters/123/quotas/456/quotastoragelimits

With a request body like this:

[source,xml]

<quota_storage_limit> <limit>50</limit> <storage_domain id="000"/> </quota_storage_limit>

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`limit`
|<<types/quota_storage_limit,QuotaStorageLimit>>
|In/Out
|

|===

[id="services/quota_storage_limits/methods/list"]
==== list [small]#GET#

Returns the list of storage limits configured for the quota.

The order of the returned list of storage limits is not guaranteed.

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`follow`
|<<types/string,String>>
|In
|Indicates which inner links should be _followed_.

|`limits`
|<<types/quota_storage_limit,QuotaStorageLimit[]>>
|Out
|

|`max`
|<<types/integer,Integer>>
|In
|Sets the maximum number of limits to return.

|===

[id="services/quota_storage_limits/methods/list/parameters/follow"]
===== follow

Indicates which inner links should be _followed_. The objects referenced by these links will be fetched as part
of the current request. See <<documents/003_common_concepts/follow, here>> for details.

[id="services/quota_storage_limits/methods/list/parameters/max"]
===== max

Sets the maximum number of limits to return. If not specified, all the limits are returned.

[id="services/quotas"]
=== Quotas

Manages the set of quotas configured for a data center.

.Methods summary
[cols="20,80"]
|===
|Name |Summary

|`add`
|Creates a new quota.

|`list`
|Lists quotas of a data center.

|===

[id="services/quotas/methods/add"]
==== add [small]#POST#

Creates a new quota.

An example of creating a new quota:

[source]

POST /ovirt-engine/api/datacenters/123/quotas

[source,xml]

<quota> <name>myquota</name> <description>My new quota for virtual machines</description> </quota>

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`quota`
|<<types/quota,Quota>>
|In/Out
|

|===

[id="services/quotas/methods/list"]
==== list [small]#GET#

Lists quotas of a data center.

The order of the returned list of quotas isn't guaranteed.

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`follow`
|<<types/string,String>>
|In
|Indicates which inner links should be _followed_.

|`max`
|<<types/integer,Integer>>
|In
|Sets the maximum number of quota descriptors to return.

|`quotas`
|<<types/quota,Quota[]>>
|Out
|

|===

[id="services/quotas/methods/list/parameters/follow"]
===== follow

Indicates which inner links should be _followed_. The objects referenced by these links will be fetched as part
of the current request. See <<documents/003_common_concepts/follow, here>> for details.

[id="services/quotas/methods/list/parameters/max"]
===== max

Sets the maximum number of quota descriptors to return. If not specified all the descriptors are returned.

[id="services/role"]
=== Role

.Methods summary
[cols="20,80"]
|===
|Name |Summary

|`get`
|Get the role.

|`remove`
|Removes the role.

|`update`
|Updates a role.

|===

[id="services/role/methods/get"]
==== get [small]#GET#

Get the role.

[source]

GET /ovirt-engine/api/roles/123

You will receive XML response like this one:

[source,xml]

<role id="123"> <name>MyRole</name> <description>MyRole description</description> <link href="/ovirt-engine/api/roles/123/permits" rel="permits"/> <administrative>true</administrative> <mutable>false</mutable> </role>

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`follow`
|<<types/string,String>>
|In
|Indicates which inner links should be _followed_.

|`role`
|<<types/role,Role>>
|Out
|Retrieved role.

|===

[id="services/role/methods/get/parameters/follow"]
===== follow

Indicates which inner links should be _followed_. The objects referenced by these links will be fetched as part
of the current request. See <<documents/003_common_concepts/follow, here>> for details.

[id="services/role/methods/remove"]
==== remove [small]#DELETE#

Removes the role.

To remove the role you need to know its id, then send request like this:

[source]

DELETE /ovirt-engine/api/roles/{role_id}

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`async`
|<<types/boolean,Boolean>>
|In
|Indicates if the remove should be performed asynchronously.

|===

[id="services/role/methods/update"]
==== update [small]#PUT#

Updates a role. You are allowed to update `name`, `description` and `administrative` attributes after role is
created. Within this endpoint you can't add or remove roles permits you need to use
<<services/permits, service>> that manages permits of role.

For example to update role's `name`, `description` and `administrative` attributes send a request like this:

[source]

PUT /ovirt-engine/api/roles/123

With a request body like this:

[source,xml]

<role> <name>MyNewRoleName</name> <description>My new description of the role</description> <administrative>true</administrative> </group>

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`async`
|<<types/boolean,Boolean>>
|In
|Indicates if the update should be performed asynchronously.

|`role`
|<<types/role,Role>>
|In/Out
|Updated role.

|===

[id="services/roles"]
=== Roles

Provides read-only access to the global set of roles

.Methods summary
[cols="20,80"]
|===
|Name |Summary

|`add`
|Create a new role.

|`list`
|List roles.

|===

[id="services/roles/methods/add"]
==== add [small]#POST#

Create a new role. The role can be administrative or non-administrative and can have different permits.

For example, to add the `MyRole` non-administrative role with permits to login and create virtual machines
send a request like this (note that you have to pass permit id):

[source]

POST /ovirt-engine/api/roles

With a request body like this:

[source,xml]

<role> <name>MyRole</name> <description>My custom role to create virtual machines</description> <administrative>false</administrative> <permits> <permit id="1"/> <permit id="1300"/> </permits> </group>

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`role`
|<<types/role,Role>>
|In/Out
|Role that will be added.

|===

[id="services/roles/methods/list"]
==== list [small]#GET#

List roles.

[source]

GET /ovirt-engine/api/roles

You will receive response in XML like this one:

[source,xml]

<roles> <role id="123"> <name>SuperUser</name> <description>Roles management administrator</description> <link href="/ovirt-engine/api/roles/123/permits" rel="permits"/> <administrative>true</administrative> <mutable>false</mutable> </role> …​ </roles>

The order of the returned list of roles isn't guaranteed.

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`follow`
|<<types/string,String>>
|In
|Indicates which inner links should be _followed_.

|`max`
|<<types/integer,Integer>>
|In
|Sets the maximum number of roles to return.

|`roles`
|<<types/role,Role[]>>
|Out
|Retrieved list of roles.

|===

[id="services/roles/methods/list/parameters/follow"]
===== follow

Indicates which inner links should be _followed_. The objects referenced by these links will be fetched as part
of the current request. See <<documents/003_common_concepts/follow, here>> for details.

[id="services/roles/methods/list/parameters/max"]
===== max

Sets the maximum number of roles to return. If not specified all the roles are returned.

[id="services/snapshot"]
=== Snapshot

.Methods summary
[cols="20,80"]
|===
|Name |Summary

|`get`
|

|`remove`
|

|`restore`
|Restores a virtual machine snapshot.

|===

[id="services/snapshot/methods/get"]
==== get [small]#GET#

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`follow`
|<<types/string,String>>
|In
|Indicates which inner links should be _followed_.

|`snapshot`
|<<types/snapshot,Snapshot>>
|Out
|

|===

[id="services/snapshot/methods/get/parameters/follow"]
===== follow

Indicates which inner links should be _followed_. The objects referenced by these links will be fetched as part
of the current request. See <<documents/003_common_concepts/follow, here>> for details.

[id="services/snapshot/methods/remove"]
==== remove [small]#DELETE#

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`all_content`
|<<types/boolean,Boolean>>
|In
|Indicates if all the attributes of the virtual machine snapshot should be included in the response.

|`async`
|<<types/boolean,Boolean>>
|In
|Indicates if the remove should be performed asynchronously.

|===

[id="services/snapshot/methods/remove/parameters/all_content"]
===== all_content

Indicates if all the attributes of the virtual machine snapshot should be included in the response.

By default the attribute `initialization.configuration.data` is excluded.

For example, to retrieve the complete representation of the snapshot with id `456` of the virtual machine
with id `123` send a request like this:

....
GET /ovirt-engine/api/vms/123/snapshots/456?all_content=true
....

[id="services/snapshot/methods/restore"]
==== restore [small]#POST#

Restores a virtual machine snapshot.

For example, to restore the snapshot with identifier `456` of virtual machine with identifier `123` send a
request like this:

[source]

POST /ovirt-engine/api/vms/123/snapshots/456/restore

With an empty `action` in the body:

[source,xml]

<action/>

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`async`
|<<types/boolean,Boolean>>
|In
|Indicates if the restore should be performed asynchronously.

|`disks`
|<<types/disk,Disk[]>>
|In
|Specify the disks included in the snapshot's restore.

|`restore_memory`
|<<types/boolean,Boolean>>
|In
|

|===

[id="services/snapshot/methods/restore/parameters/disks"]
===== disks

Specify the disks included in the snapshot's restore.

For each disk parameter, it is also required to specify its `image_id`.

For example, to restore a snapshot with an identifier `456` of a virtual machine with identifier `123`, including
a disk with identifier `111` and `image_id` of `222`, send a request like this:

[source]

POST /ovirt-engine/api/vms/123/snapshots/456/restore

Request body:

[source,xml]

<action> <disks> <disk id="111"> <image_id>222</image_id> </disk> </disks> </action>

[id="services/snapshot_disks"]
=== SnapshotDisks

Manages the set of disks of an snapshot.

.Methods summary
[cols="20,80"]
|===
|Name |Summary

|`list`
|Returns the list of disks of the snapshot.

|===

[id="services/snapshot_disks/methods/list"]
==== list [small]#GET#

Returns the list of disks of the snapshot.

The order of the returned list of disks isn't guaranteed.

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`disks`
|<<types/disk,Disk[]>>
|Out
|

|`follow`
|<<types/string,String>>
|In
|Indicates which inner links should be _followed_.

|`max`
|<<types/integer,Integer>>
|In
|Sets the maximum number of disks to return.

|===

[id="services/snapshot_disks/methods/list/parameters/follow"]
===== follow

Indicates which inner links should be _followed_. The objects referenced by these links will be fetched as part
of the current request. See <<documents/003_common_concepts/follow, here>> for details.

[id="services/snapshot_disks/methods/list/parameters/max"]
===== max

Sets the maximum number of disks to return. If not specified all the disks are returned.

[id="services/snapshots"]
=== Snapshots

Manages the set of snapshots of a storage domain or virtual machine.

.Methods summary
[cols="20,80"]
|===
|Name |Summary

|`add`
|Creates a virtual machine snapshot.

|`list`
|Returns the list of snapshots of the storage domain or virtual machine.

|===

[id="services/snapshots/methods/add"]
==== add [small]#POST#

Creates a virtual machine snapshot.

For example, to create a new snapshot for virtual machine `123` send a request like this:

[source]

POST /ovirt-engine/api/vms/123/snapshots

With a request body like this:

[source,xml]

<snapshot> <description>My snapshot</description> </snapshot>

For including only a sub-set of disks in the snapshots, add `disk_attachments` element to the
request body. Note that disks which are not specified in `disk_attachments` element will not be a
part of the snapshot. If an empty `disk_attachments` element is passed, the snapshot will include
only the virtual machine configuration. If no `disk_attachments` element is passed, then all
the disks will be included in the snapshot.

For each disk, `image_id` element can be specified for setting the new active image id.
This is used in order to restore a chain of images from backup. I.e. when restoring
a disk with snapshots, the relevant `image_id` should be specified for each snapshot
(so the identifiers of the disk snapshots are identical to the backup).

[source,xml]

<snapshot> <description>My snapshot</description> <disk_attachments> <disk_attachment> <disk id="123"> <image_id>456</image_id> </disk> </disk_attachment> </disk_attachments> </snapshot>

[IMPORTANT]
====
When a snapshot is created the default value for the <<types/snapshot/attributes/persist_memorystate,
persist_memorystate>> attribute is `true`. That means that the content of the memory of the virtual
machine will be included in the snapshot, and it also means that the virtual machine will be paused
for a longer time. That can negatively affect applications that are very sensitive to timing (NTP
servers, for example). In those cases make sure that you set the attribute to `false`:

[source,xml]

<snapshot> <description>My snapshot</description> <persist_memorystate>false</persist_memorystate> </snapshot>

====

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`snapshot`
|<<types/snapshot,Snapshot>>
|In/Out
|

|===

[id="services/snapshots/methods/list"]
==== list [small]#GET#

Returns the list of snapshots of the storage domain or virtual machine.

The order of the returned list of snapshots isn't guaranteed.

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`all_content`
|<<types/boolean,Boolean>>
|In
|Indicates if all the attributes of the virtual machine snapshot should be included in the response.

|`follow`
|<<types/string,String>>
|In
|Indicates which inner links should be _followed_.

|`max`
|<<types/integer,Integer>>
|In
|Sets the maximum number of snapshots to return.

|`snapshots`
|<<types/snapshot,Snapshot[]>>
|Out
|

|===

[id="services/snapshots/methods/list/parameters/all_content"]
===== all_content

Indicates if all the attributes of the virtual machine snapshot should be included in the response.

By default the attribute `initialization.configuration.data` is excluded.

For example, to retrieve the complete representation of the virtual machine with id `123` snapshots send a
request like this:

....
GET /ovirt-engine/api/vms/123/snapshots?all_content=true
....

[id="services/snapshots/methods/list/parameters/follow"]
===== follow

Indicates which inner links should be _followed_. The objects referenced by these links will be fetched as part
of the current request. See <<documents/003_common_concepts/follow, here>> for details.

[id="services/snapshots/methods/list/parameters/max"]
===== max

Sets the maximum number of snapshots to return. If not specified all the snapshots are returned.

[id="services/ssh_public_keys"]

|

|`list`
|Returns a list of SSH public keys of the user.

|===

[id="services/ssh_public_keys/methods/add"]
==== add [small]#POST#

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`key`
|<<types/ssh_public_key,SshPublicKey>>
|In/Out
|

|===

[id="services/ssh_public_keys/methods/list"]
==== list [small]#GET#

Returns a list of SSH public keys of the user.

For example, to retrieve the list of SSH keys of user with identifier `123`,
send a request like this:

[source]

GET /ovirt-engine/api/users/123/sshpublickeys

The result will be the following XML document:

[source,xml]

<ssh_public_keys> <ssh_public_key href="/ovirt-engine/api/users/123/sshpublickeys/456" id="456"> <content>ssh-rsa …​</content> <user href="/ovirt-engine/api/users/123" id="123"/> </ssh_public_key> </ssh_public_keys>

Or the following JSON object

[source,json]

{ "ssh_public_key": [ { "content": "ssh-rsa …​", "user": { "href": "/ovirt-engine/api/users/123", "id": "123" }, "href": "/ovirt-engine/api/users/123/sshpublickeys/456", "id": "456" } ] }

The order of the returned list of keys is not guaranteed.

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`follow`
|<<types/string,String>>
|In
|Indicates which inner links should be _followed_.

|`keys`
|<<types/ssh_public_key,SshPublicKey[]>>
|Out
|

|`max`
|<<types/integer,Integer>>
|In
|Sets the maximum number of keys to return.

|===

[id="services/ssh_public_keys/methods/list/parameters/follow"]
===== follow

Indicates which inner links should be _followed_. The objects referenced by these links will be fetched as part
of the current request. See <<documents/003_common_concepts/follow, here>> for details.

[id="services/ssh_public_keys/methods/list/parameters/max"]
===== max

Sets the maximum number of keys to return. If not specified all the keys are returned.

[id="services/statistics"]
=== Statistics

.Methods summary
[cols="20,80"]
|===
|Name |Summary

|`list`
|Retrieves a list of statistics.

|===

[id="services/statistics/methods/list"]
==== list [small]#GET#

Retrieves a list of statistics.

For example, to retrieve the statistics for virtual machine `123` send a
request like this:

[source]

GET /ovirt-engine/api/vms/123/statistics

The result will be like this:

[source,xml]

<statistics> <statistic href="/ovirt-engine/api/vms/123/statistics/456" id="456"> <name>memory.installed</name> <description>Total memory configured</description> <kind>gauge</kind> <type>integer</type> <unit>bytes</unit> <values> <value> <datum>1073741824</datum> </value> </values> <vm href="/ovirt-engine/api/vms/123" id="123"/> </statistic> …​ </statistics>

Just a single part of the statistics can be retrieved by specifying its id at the end of the URI. That means:

[source]

GET /ovirt-engine/api/vms/123/statistics/456

Outputs:

[source,xml]

<statistic href="/ovirt-engine/api/vms/123/statistics/456" id="456"> <name>memory.installed</name> <description>Total memory configured</description> <kind>gauge</kind> <type>integer</type> <unit>bytes</unit> <values> <value> <datum>1073741824</datum> </value> </values> <vm href="/ovirt-engine/api/vms/123" id="123"/> </statistic>

The order of the returned list of statistics isn't guaranteed.

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`follow`
|<<types/string,String>>
|In
|Indicates which inner links should be _followed_.

|`max`
|<<types/integer,Integer>>
|In
|Sets the maximum number of statistics to return.

|`statistics`
|<<types/statistic,Statistic[]>>
|Out
|

|===

[id="services/statistics/methods/list/parameters/follow"]
===== follow

Indicates which inner links should be _followed_. The objects referenced by these links will be fetched as part
of the current request. See <<documents/003_common_concepts/follow, here>> for details.

[id="services/statistics/methods/list/parameters/max"]
===== max

Sets the maximum number of statistics to return. If not specified all the statistics are returned.

[id="services/step"]
=== Step

A service to manage a step.

.Methods summary
[cols="20,80"]
|===
|Name |Summary

|`end`
|Marks an external step execution as ended.

|`get`
|Retrieves a step.

|===

[id="services/step/methods/end"]
==== end [small]#POST#

Marks an external step execution as ended.

For example, to terminate a step with identifier `456` which belongs to a `job` with identifier `123` send the
following request:

[source]

POST /ovirt-engine/api/jobs/123/steps/456/end

With the following request body:

[source,xml]

<action> <force>true</force> <succeeded>true</succeeded> </action>

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`async`
|<<types/boolean,Boolean>>
|In
|Indicates if the action should be performed asynchronously.

|`force`
|<<types/boolean,Boolean>>
|In
|Indicates if the step should be forcibly terminated.

|`succeeded`
|<<types/boolean,Boolean>>
|In
|Indicates if the step should be marked as successfully finished or as failed.

|===

[id="services/step/methods/end/parameters/succeeded"]
===== succeeded

Indicates if the step should be marked as successfully finished or as failed.

This parameter is optional, and the default value is `true`.

[id="services/step/methods/get"]
==== get [small]#GET#

Retrieves a step.

[source]

GET /ovirt-engine/api/jobs/123/steps/456

You will receive response in XML like this one:

[source,xml]

<step href="/ovirt-engine/api/jobs/123/steps/456" id="456"> <actions> <link href="/ovirt-engine/api/jobs/123/steps/456/end" rel="end"/> </actions> <description>Validating</description> <end_time>2016-12-12T23:07:26.627+02:00</end_time> <external>false</external> <number>0</number> <start_time>2016-12-12T23:07:26.605+02:00</start_time> <status>finished</status> <type>validating</type> <job href="/ovirt-engine/api/jobs/123" id="123"/> </step>

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`follow`
|<<types/string,String>>
|In
|Indicates which inner links should be _followed_.

|`step`
|<<types/step,Step>>
|Out
|Retrieves the representation of the step.

|===

[id="services/step/methods/get/parameters/follow"]
===== follow

Indicates which inner links should be _followed_. The objects referenced by these links will be fetched as part
of the current request. See <<documents/003_common_concepts/follow, here>> for details.

[id="services/steps"]
=== Steps

A service to manage steps.

.Methods summary
[cols="20,80"]
|===
|Name |Summary

|`add`
|Add an external step to an existing job or to an existing step.

|`list`
|Retrieves the representation of the steps.

|===

[id="services/steps/methods/add"]
==== add [small]#POST#

Add an external step to an existing job or to an existing step.

For example, to add a step to `job` with identifier `123` send the
following request:

[source]

POST /ovirt-engine/api/jobs/123/steps

With the following request body:

[source,xml]

<step> <description>Validating</description> <start_time>2016-12-12T23:07:26.605+02:00</start_time> <status>started</status> <type>validating</type> </step>

The response should look like:

[source,xml]

<step href="/ovirt-engine/api/jobs/123/steps/456" id="456"> <actions> <link href="/ovirt-engine/api/jobs/123/steps/456/end" rel="end"/> </actions> <description>Validating</description> <link href="/ovirt-engine/api/jobs/123/steps/456/statistics" rel="statistics"/> <external>true</external> <number>2</number> <start_time>2016-12-13T01:06:15.380+02:00</start_time> <status>started</status> <type>validating</type> <job href="/ovirt-engine/api/jobs/123" id="123"/> </step>

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`step`
|<<types/step,Step>>
|In/Out
|Step that will be added.

|===

[id="services/steps/methods/list"]
==== list [small]#GET#

Retrieves the representation of the steps.

[source]

GET /ovirt-engine/api/job/123/steps

You will receive response in XML like this one:

[source,xml]

<steps> <step href="/ovirt-engine/api/jobs/123/steps/456" id="456"> <actions> <link href="/ovirt-engine/api/jobs/123/steps/456/end" rel="end"/> </actions> <description>Validating</description> <link href="/ovirt-engine/api/jobs/123/steps/456/statistics" rel="statistics"/> <external>true</external> <number>2</number> <start_time>2016-12-13T01:06:15.380+02:00</start_time> <status>started</status> <type>validating</type> <job href="/ovirt-engine/api/jobs/123" id="123"/> </step> …​ </steps>

The order of the returned list of steps isn't guaranteed.

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`follow`
|<<types/string,String>>
|In
|Indicates which inner links should be _followed_.

|`max`
|<<types/integer,Integer>>
|In
|Sets the maximum number of steps to return.

|`steps`
|<<types/step,Step[]>>
|Out
|A representation of steps.

|===

[id="services/steps/methods/list/parameters/follow"]
===== follow

Indicates which inner links should be _followed_. The objects referenced by these links will be fetched as part
of the current request. See <<documents/003_common_concepts/follow, here>> for details.

[id="services/steps/methods/list/parameters/max"]
===== max

Sets the maximum number of steps to return. If not specified all the steps are returned.

[id="services/storage"]
=== Storage

.Methods summary
[cols="20,80"]
|===
|Name |Summary

|`get`
|

|===

[id="services/storage/methods/get"]
==== get [small]#GET#

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`follow`
|<<types/string,String>>
|In
|Indicates which inner links should be _followed_.

|`report_status`
|<<types/boolean,Boolean>>
|In
|Indicates if the status of the LUNs in the storage should be checked.

|`storage`
|<<types/host_storage,HostStorage>>
|Out
|

|===

[id="services/storage/methods/get/parameters/follow"]
===== follow

Indicates which inner links should be _followed_. The objects referenced by these links will be fetched as part
of the current request. See <<documents/003_common_concepts/follow, here>> for details.

[id="services/storage/methods/get/parameters/report_status"]
===== report_status

Indicates if the status of the LUNs in the storage should be checked.
Checking the status of the LUN is an heavy weight operation and
this data is not always needed by the user.
This parameter will give the option to not perform the status check of the LUNs.

The default is `true` for backward compatibility.

Here an example with the LUN status :

[source,xml]

<host_storage id="360014051136c20574f743bdbd28177fd"> <logical_units> <logical_unit id="360014051136c20574f743bdbd28177fd"> <lun_mapping>0</lun_mapping> <paths>1</paths> <product_id>lun0</product_id> <serial>SLIO-ORG_lun0_1136c205-74f7-43bd-bd28-177fd5ce6993</serial> <size>10737418240</size> <status>used</status> <vendor_id>LIO-ORG</vendor_id> <volume_group_id>O9Du7I-RahN-ECe1-dZ1w-nh0b-64io-MNzIBZ</volume_group_id> </logical_unit> </logical_units> <type>iscsi</type> <host id="8bb5ade5-e988-4000-8b93-dbfc6717fe50"/> </host_storage>

Here an example without the LUN status :

[source,xml]

<host_storage id="360014051136c20574f743bdbd28177fd"> <logical_units> <logical_unit id="360014051136c20574f743bdbd28177fd"> <lun_mapping>0</lun_mapping> <paths>1</paths> <product_id>lun0</product_id> <serial>SLIO-ORG_lun0_1136c205-74f7-43bd-bd28-177fd5ce6993</serial> <size>10737418240</size> <vendor_id>LIO-ORG</vendor_id> <volume_group_id>O9Du7I-RahN-ECe1-dZ1w-nh0b-64io-MNzIBZ</volume_group_id> </logical_unit> </logical_units> <type>iscsi</type> <host id="8bb5ade5-e988-4000-8b93-dbfc6717fe50"/> </host_storage>

[id="services/storage_domain"]
=== StorageDomain

.Methods summary
[cols="20,80"]
|===
|Name |Summary

|`get`
|Retrieves the description of the storage domain.

|`isattached`
|Used for querying if the storage domain is already attached to a data center using
the is_attached boolean field, which is part of the storage server.

|`reduceluns`
|This operation reduces logical units from the storage domain.

|`refreshluns`
|This operation refreshes the LUN size.

|`remove`
|Removes the storage domain.

|`update`
|Updates a storage domain.

|`updateovfstore`
|This operation forces the update of the `OVF_STORE`
of this storage domain.

|===

[id="services/storage_domain/methods/get"]
==== get [small]#GET#

Retrieves the description of the storage domain.

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`filter`
|<<types/boolean,Boolean>>
|In
|Indicates if the results should be filtered according to the permissions of the user.

|`follow`
|<<types/string,String>>
|In
|Indicates which inner links should be _followed_.

|`storage_domain`
|<<types/storage_domain,StorageDomain>>
|Out
|The description of the storage domain.

|===

[id="services/storage_domain/methods/get/parameters/follow"]
===== follow

Indicates which inner links should be _followed_. The objects referenced by these links will be fetched as part
of the current request. See <<documents/003_common_concepts/follow, here>> for details.

[id="services/storage_domain/methods/is_attached"]
==== isattached [small]#POST#

Used for querying if the storage domain is already attached to a data center using
the is_attached boolean field, which is part of the storage server. IMPORTANT:
Executing this API will cause the host to disconnect from the storage domain.

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`async`
|<<types/boolean,Boolean>>
|In
|Indicates if the action should be performed asynchronously.

|`host`
|<<types/host,Host>>
|In
|Indicates the data center's host.

|`is_attached`
|<<types/boolean,Boolean>>
|Out
|Indicates whether the storage domain is attached to the data center.

|===

[id="services/storage_domain/methods/reduce_luns"]
==== reduceluns [small]#POST#

This operation reduces logical units from the storage domain.

In order to do so the data stored on the provided logical units will be moved to other logical units of the
storage domain and only then they will be reduced from the storage domain.

For example, in order to reduce two logical units from a storage domain send a request like this:

[source]

POST /ovirt-engine/api/storageDomains/123/reduceluns

With a request body like this:

[source,xml]
<action>
  <logical_units>
    <logical_unit id="1IET_00010001"/>
    <logical_unit id="1IET_00010002"/>
  </logical_units>
</action>
 Note that this operation is only applicable to block storage domains (i.e., storage domains with the
 <<types/storage_type, storage type> of iSCSI or FCP).

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`logical_units`
|<<types/logical_unit,LogicalUnit[]>>
|In
|The logical units that need to be reduced from the storage domain.

|===

[id="services/storage_domain/methods/refresh_luns"]
==== refreshluns [small]#POST#

This operation refreshes the LUN size.

After increasing the size of the underlying LUN on the storage server,
the user can refresh the LUN size.
This action forces a rescan of the provided LUNs and
updates the database with the new size, if required.

For example, in order to refresh the size of two LUNs send a request like this:

[source]

POST /ovirt-engine/api/storageDomains/262b056b-aede-40f1-9666-b883eff59d40/refreshluns

With a request body like this:

[source,xml]
<action>
  <logical_units>
    <logical_unit id="1IET_00010001"/>
    <logical_unit id="1IET_00010002"/>
  </logical_units>
</action>
.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`async`
|<<types/boolean,Boolean>>
|In
|Indicates if the refresh should be performed asynchronously.

|`logical_units`
|<<types/logical_unit,LogicalUnit[]>>
|In
|The LUNs that need to be refreshed.

|===

[id="services/storage_domain/methods/remove"]
==== remove [small]#DELETE#

Removes the storage domain.

Without any special parameters, the storage domain is detached from the system and removed from the database. The
storage domain can then be imported to the same or to a different setup, with all the data on it. If the storage is
not accessible the operation will fail.

If the `destroy` parameter is `true` then the operation will always succeed, even if the storage is not
accessible, the failure is just ignored and the storage domain is removed from the database anyway.

If the `format` parameter is `true` then the actual storage is formatted, and the metadata is removed from the
LUN or directory, so it can no longer be imported to the same or to a different setup.

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`async`
|<<types/boolean,Boolean>>
|In
|Indicates if the remove should be performed asynchronously.

|`destroy`
|<<types/boolean,Boolean>>
|In
|Indicates if the operation should succeed, and the storage domain removed from the database, even if the
storage is not accessible.

|`format`
|<<types/boolean,Boolean>>
|In
|Indicates if the actual storage should be formatted, removing all the metadata from the underlying LUN or
directory:

[source]

DELETE /ovirt-engine/api/storageDomains/123?format=true

This parameter is optional, and the default value is `false`.

|`host`
|<<types/string,String>>
|In
|Indicates which host should be used to remove the storage domain.

|===

[id="services/storage_domain/methods/remove/parameters/destroy"]
===== destroy

Indicates if the operation should succeed, and the storage domain removed from the database, even if the
storage is not accessible.

[source]

DELETE /ovirt-engine/api/storageDomains/123?destroy=true

This parameter is optional, and the default value is `false`.
When the value of `destroy` is `true` the `host` parameter will be ignored.

[id="services/storage_domain/methods/remove/parameters/host"]
===== host

Indicates which host should be used to remove the storage domain.

This parameter is mandatory, except if the `destroy` parameter is included and its value is `true`, in that
case the `host` parameter will be ignored.

The value should contain the name or the identifier of the host. For example, to use the host named `myhost`
to remove the storage domain with identifier `123` send a request like this:

[source]

DELETE /ovirt-engine/api/storageDomains/123?host=myhost

[id="services/storage_domain/methods/update"]
==== update [small]#PUT#

Updates a storage domain.

Not all of the <<types/storage_domain,StorageDomain>>'s attributes are updatable after creation. Those that can be
updated are: `name`, `description`, `comment`, `warning_low_space_indicator`, `critical_space_action_blocker` and
`wipe_after_delete.` (Note that changing the `wipe_after_delete` attribute will not change the wipe after delete
property of disks that already exist).

To update the `name` and `wipe_after_delete` attributes of a storage domain with an identifier `123`, send a
request as follows:

[source]

PUT /ovirt-engine/api/storageDomains/123

With a request body as follows:

[source,xml]

<storage_domain> <name>data2</name> <wipe_after_delete>true</wipe_after_delete> </storage_domain>

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`async`
|<<types/boolean,Boolean>>
|In
|Indicates if the update should be performed asynchronously.

|`storage_domain`
|<<types/storage_domain,StorageDomain>>
|In/Out
|The updated storage domain.

|===

[id="services/storage_domain/methods/update_ovf_store"]
==== updateovfstore [small]#POST#

This operation forces the update of the `OVF_STORE`
of this storage domain.

The `OVF_STORE` is a disk image that contains the metadata
of virtual machines and disks that reside in the
storage domain. This metadata is used in case the
domain is imported or exported to or from a different
data center or a different installation.

By default the `OVF_STORE` is updated periodically
(set by default to 60 minutes) but users might want to force an
update after an important change, or when the they believe the
`OVF_STORE` is corrupt.

When initiated by the user, `OVF_STORE` update will be performed whether
an update is needed or not.

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`async`
|<<types/boolean,Boolean>>
|In
|Indicates if the `OVF_STORE` update should be performed asynchronously.

|===

[id="services/storage_domain_content_disk"]
=== StorageDomainContentDisk

.Methods summary
[cols="20,80"]
|===
|Name |Summary

|`get`
|

|===

[id="services/storage_domain_content_disk/methods/get"]
==== get [small]#GET#

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`disk`
|<<types/disk,Disk>>
|Out
|

|`filter`
|<<types/boolean,Boolean>>
|In
|Indicates if the results should be filtered according to the permissions of the user.

|`follow`
|<<types/string,String>>
|In
|Indicates which inner links should be _followed_.

|===

Indicates which inner links should be _followed_. The objects referenced by these links will be fetched as part
of the current request. See <<documents/003_common_concepts/follow, here>> for details.

[id="services/storage_domain_content_disks"]
=== StorageDomainContentDisks

Manages the set of disks available in a storage domain.

.Methods summary
[cols="20,80"]
|===
|Name |Summary

|`list`
|Returns the list of disks available in the storage domain.

|===

[id="services/storage_domain_content_disks/methods/list"]
==== list [small]#GET#

Returns the list of disks available in the storage domain.

The order of the returned list of disks is guaranteed only if the `sortby` clause is included in
the `search` parameter.

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`case_sensitive`
|<<types/boolean,Boolean>>
|In
|Indicates if the search performed using the `search` parameter should be performed taking case into
account.

|`disks`
|<<types/disk,Disk[]>>
|Out
|

|`follow`
|<<types/string,String>>
|In
|Indicates which inner links should be _followed_.

|`max`
|<<types/integer,Integer>>
|In
|Sets the maximum number of disks to return.

|`search`
|<<types/string,String>>
|In
|A query string used to restrict the returned disks.

|===

[id="services/storage_domain_content_disks/methods/list/parameters/case_sensitive"]
===== case_sensitive

Indicates if the search performed using the `search` parameter should be performed taking case into
account. The default value is `true`, which means that case is taken into account. If you want to search
ignoring case set it to `false`.

[id="services/storage_domain_content_disks/methods/list/parameters/follow"]
===== follow

Indicates which inner links should be _followed_. The objects referenced by these links will be fetched as part
of the current request. See <<documents/003_common_concepts/follow, here>> for details.

[id="services/storage_domain_content_disks/methods/list/parameters/max"]
===== max

Sets the maximum number of disks to return. If not specified all the disks are returned.

[id="services/storage_domain_disk"]
=== StorageDomainDisk

Manages a single disk available in a storage domain.

IMPORTANT: Since version 4.2 of the engine this service is intended only to list disks available in the storage
domain, and to register unregistered disks. All the other operations, like copying a disk, moving a disk, etc, have
been deprecated and will be removed in the future. To perform those operations use the <<services/disks, service
that manages all the disks of the system>>, or the <<services/disk, service that manages an specific disk>>.

.Methods summary
[cols="20,80"]
|===
|Name |Summary

|`copy`
|Copies a disk to the specified storage domain.

|`export`
|Exports a disk to an export storage domain.

|`get`
|Retrieves the description of the disk.

|`move`
|Moves a disk to another storage domain.

|`reduce`
|Reduces the size of the disk image.

|`remove`
|Removes a disk.

|`sparsify`
|Sparsify the disk.

|`update`
|Updates the disk.

|===

[id="services/storage_domain_disk/methods/copy"]
==== copy [small]#POST#

Copies a disk to the specified storage domain.

IMPORTANT: Since version 4.2 of the engine this operation is deprecated, and preserved only for backwards
compatibility. It will be removed in the future. To copy a disk use the <<services/disk/methods/copy, copy>>
operation of the service that manages that disk.

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`disk`
|<<types/disk,Disk>>
|In
|Description of the resulting disk.

|`storage_domain`
|<<types/storage_domain,StorageDomain>>
|In
|The storage domain where the new disk will be created.

|===

[id="services/storage_domain_disk/methods/export"]
==== export [small]#POST#

Exports a disk to an export storage domain.

IMPORTANT: Since version 4.2 of the engine this operation is deprecated, and preserved only for backwards
compatibility. It will be removed in the future. To export a disk use the <<services/disk/methods/export, export>>
operation of the service that manages that disk.

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`storage_domain`
|<<types/storage_domain,StorageDomain>>
|In
|The export storage domain where the disk should be exported to.

|===

[id="services/storage_domain_disk/methods/get"]
==== get [small]#GET#

Retrieves the description of the disk.

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`disk`
|<<types/disk,Disk>>
|Out
|The description of the disk.

|`follow`
|<<types/string,String>>
|In
|Indicates which inner links should be _followed_.

|===

[id="services/storage_domain_disk/methods/get/parameters/follow"]
===== follow

Indicates which inner links should be _followed_. The objects referenced by these links will be fetched as part
of the current request. See <<documents/003_common_concepts/follow, here>> for details.

[id="services/storage_domain_disk/methods/move"]
==== move [small]#POST#

Moves a disk to another storage domain.

IMPORTANT: Since version 4.2 of the engine this operation is deprecated, and preserved only for backwards
compatibility. It will be removed in the future. To move a disk use the <<services/disk/methods/move, move>>
operation of the service that manages that disk.

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`async`
|<<types/boolean,Boolean>>
|In
|Indicates if the move should be performed asynchronously.

|`filter`
|<<types/boolean,Boolean>>
|In
|Indicates if the results should be filtered according to the permissions of the user.

|`storage_domain`
|<<types/storage_domain,StorageDomain>>
|In
|The storage domain where the disk will be moved to.

|===

[id="services/storage_domain_disk/methods/reduce"]
==== reduce [small]#POST#

Reduces the size of the disk image.

Invokes _reduce_ on the logical volume (i.e. this is only applicable for block storage domains).
This is applicable for floating disks and disks attached to non-running virtual machines.
There is no need to specify the size as the optimal size is calculated automatically.

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`async`
|<<types/boolean,Boolean>>
|In
|Indicates if the remove should be performed asynchronously.

|===

[id="services/storage_domain_disk/methods/remove"]
==== remove [small]#DELETE#

Removes a disk.

IMPORTANT: Since version 4.2 of the engine this operation is deprecated, and preserved only for backwards
compatibility. It will be removed in the future. To remove a disk use the <<services/disk/methods/remove, remove>>
operation of the service that manages that disk.

[id="services/storage_domain_disk/methods/sparsify"]
==== sparsify [small]#POST#

Sparsify the disk.

IMPORTANT: Since version 4.2 of the engine this operation is deprecated, and preserved only for backwards
compatibility. It will be removed in the future. To remove a disk use the <<services/disk/methods/remove, remove>>
operation of the service that manages that disk.

[id="services/storage_domain_disk/methods/update"]
==== update [small]#PUT#

Updates the disk.

IMPORTANT: Since version 4.2 of the engine this operation is deprecated, and preserved only for backwards
compatibility. It will be removed in the future. To update a disk use the
<<services/disk/methods/update, update>> operation of the service that manages that disk.

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`disk`
|<<types/disk,Disk>>
|In/Out
|The update to apply to the disk.

|===

[id="services/storage_domain_disks"]
=== StorageDomainDisks

Manages the collection of disks available inside a specific storage domain.

.Methods summary
[cols="20,80"]
|===
|Name |Summary

|`add`
|Adds or registers a disk.

|`list`
|Retrieves the list of disks that are available in the storage domain.

|===

[id="services/storage_domain_disks/methods/add"]
==== add [small]#POST#

Adds or registers a disk.

IMPORTANT: Since version 4.2 of the {engine-name} this operation is deprecated, and preserved only for backwards
compatibility. It will be removed in the future. To add a new disk use the <<services/disks/methods/add, add>>
operation of the service that manages the disks of the system. To register an unregistered disk use the
<<services/attached_storage_domain_disk/methods/register, register>> operation of the service that manages
that disk.

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`disk`
|<<types/disk,Disk>>
|In/Out
|The disk to add or register.

|`unregistered`
|<<types/boolean,Boolean>>
|In
|Indicates if a new disk should be added or if an existing unregistered disk should be registered.

|===

[id="services/storage_domain_disks/methods/add/parameters/unregistered"]
===== unregistered

Indicates if a new disk should be added or if an existing unregistered disk should be registered. If the
value is `true` then the identifier of the disk to register needs to be provided. For example, to register
the disk with ID `456` send a request like this:

....
POST /ovirt-engine/api/storagedomains/123/disks?unregistered=true
....

With a request body like this:

[source,xml]

<disk id="456"/>

If the value is `false` then a new disk will be created in the storage domain. In that case the
`provisioned_size`, `format`, and `name` attributes are mandatory. For example, to create a new
_copy on write_ disk of 1 GiB, send a request like this:

....
POST /ovirt-engine/api/storagedomains/123/disks
....

With a request body like this:

[source,xml]

<disk> <name>mydisk</name> <format>cow</format> <provisioned_size>1073741824</provisioned_size> </disk>

The default value is `false`.

This parameter has been deprecated since version 4.2 of
the {engine-name}.

[id="services/storage_domain_disks/methods/list"]
==== list [small]#GET#

Retrieves the list of disks that are available in the storage domain.

The order of the returned list of disks is not guaranteed.

.Parameters summary
[cols="15,15,20,50"]
|===
|Name |Type |Direction |Summary

|`disks`
|<<types/disk,Disk[]>>
|Out
|The list of retrieved disks.

|`follow`
|<<types/string,String>>
|In
|Indicates which inner links should be _followed_.

|`max`
|<<types/integer,Integer>>
|In
|Sets the maximum number of disks to return.

|`unregistered`
|<<types/boolean,Boolean>>
|In
|Indicates whether to retrieve a list of registered or unregistered disks in the storage domain.

|===

[id="services/storage_domain_disks/methods/list/parameters/follow"]
===== follow

Indicates which inner links should be _followed_. The objects referenced by these links will be fetched as part
of the current request. See <<documents/003_common_concepts/follow, here>> for details.

[id="services/storage_domain_disks/methods/list/parameters/max"]
===== max

Sets the maximum number of disks to return. If not specified, all the disks are returned.

[id="services/storage_domain_disks/methods/list/parameters/unregistered"]
===== unregistered

Indicates whether to retrieve a list of registered or unregistered disks in the storage domain.
To get a list of unregistered disks in the storage domain the call should indicate the unregistered flag.
For example, to get a list of unregistered disks the REST API call should look like this:

....
GET /ovirt-engine/api/storagedomains/123/disks?unregistered=true
....

The default value of the unregistered flag is `false`.
The request only applies to storage domains that are attached.
